Package edu.cuny.ai.learning

A library of learning algorithms.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ContinuousLearner A learning algorithm that outputs a continuous signal.
DiscreteLearner A learner that learns a discrete number of different actions.
ExposedStimuliResponseLearner This interface defines additional methods for debugging purpose only.
Learner Classes implementing this interface indicate that they implement a learning algorithm.
LearnerMonitor A interface for monitoring the functioning of a learner.
LearningPolicy An interface that should be implemented by all policies for learners.
MDPLearner Classes implementing this interface implement learning algorithms for markoff descision processes.
MimicryLearner A learner that attempts to adjust its output to match a training signal.
SelfKnowledgable Classes implementing this interface indicate that they know if their output is good enough to be used.
StimuliResponseLearner Classes implementing this interface implement myopic stimuli-response reinformcement learning algorithms.
 

Class Summary
AbstractLearner  
ActionChoosingPolicy A policy framework used by DiscreteLearner to choose an action out of multiple discrete actions.
AdaptiveReturnUpdatingPolicy A policy used by StimuliResponseLearner to update the expected returns of multiple discrete actions.
AdaptiveReturnUpdatingPolicyWithBias An expected return updating policy that uses bias towards those untaken actions each time.
AveragingLearner predicts with the average of inputs, weighing the inputs equally, in contrast to the discounting weights to inputs over time in WidrowHoffLearner.
DumbLearner A learner that chooses the same specified action on every iteration.
DumbRandomLearner A learner that simply plays a random action on each iteration without any learning.
EpsilonGreedyActionChoosingPolicy A policy used by StimuliResponseLearner to update the expected returns of multiple discrete actions based on the epsilon-greedy method in Section 2.2, Sutton and Barto's RL book
EpsilonGreedyMultiActionChoosingPolicy A policy that chooses multiple actions from a set of actions based on their expected returns, using a EpsilonGreedyActionChoosingPolicy to choose these actions one by one.
MetaLearner A meta learner combines multiple learners and based on their performance, gives preference to better ones.
MultiActionChoosingPolicy A policy framework to choose multiple actions out of a set of discrete actions based on expected returns of these actions.
NArmedBanditLearner A learner that implements a solution framework for the n-armed bandit problem described in Section 2.2, Sutton and Barto's RL book.
NPTRothErevLearner A modification of RothErev to address parameter degeneracy, and modified learning with 0-reward.
QLearner An implementation of the Q-learning algorithm, with epsilon-greedy exploration.
RandomActionChoosingPolicy A policy used by StimuliResponseLearner to randomly choose an action from the action set.
ReturnUpdatingPolicy A policy used by StimuliResponseLearner to update the expected returns of multiple discrete actions.
ReverseDiscountSlidingLearner tracks a series of signals, whose impacts fade over time and overlap linearly.
RothErevLearner A class implementing the Roth-Erev learning algorithm.
SlidingWindowLearner maintains a sliding window over the trained data series and use the average of data items falling into the window as the output learned.
SoftmaxActionChoosingPolicy A policy used by StimuliResponseLearner to update the expected returns of multiple discrete actions based on the softmax method in Section 2.3, Sutton and Barto's RL book
SoftmaxMultiActionChoosingPolicy A policy that chooses multiple actions from a set of actions based on their expected returns, using a SoftmaxActionChoosingPolicy to choose these actions one by one.
SortedSlidingWindowLearner maintains a sorted sliding window over the trained data series and use a percentage to determine a data item in the window as the output learned.
StatelessQLearner A memory-less version of the Q-Learning algorithm.
WidrowHoffLearner An implementation of the Widrow-Hoff learning algorithm for 1-dimensional training sets.
WidrowHoffLearnerWithMomentum An extension of WidrowHoffLearner that supports the discounted effect of cumulative training signal, i.e.
 

Package edu.cuny.ai.learning Description

A library of learning algorithms.
